page.title: 02FARMING IN NORTH TYNEDALE
page.content: The{farms}in the area are - Ealingham 84/80, Buteland 87/81, Anton Hill 85/80, Countess Park 86/81, Lea Hall 86/80, The Heugh 88/80, Wood Park 84/79, The Green 85/79, Carry House 86/79, Birtley Shield 87/79, Bank Head 84/79. All the mentioned farms are basically stock rearing hill farms, mostly specialising in the sale of suckler calves and mule lambs. The {cows}are mainly Angus and Hereford cross, which are put to Continental Bulls, e.g.Charolais, Limousin or Blonde. The{sheep}are basically Blackface or Swaledale cross, these are crossed with the Bluefaced Leicester, to produce a Mule lamb. About a 1/4 of each farm is used for hay or silage for{winter feed,}with a small acreage used for growing barley, for winter consumption on the farm.
